item.title: Major Error
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:7, topic:191740”][quote author=Stanyer link=topic=255400.msg2127543#msg2127543 date=1206218760]

[quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=255400.msg2127541#msg2127541 date=1206218718]

int capes2[].
[/quote]that’s a whole new int -.- lol, i know for sure that wouldn’t work.

same error, different ^…

::: Compiling :::
:::::::::::::::::
Item.java:6: code too large
public static int capes[] = {8278,8284,8285,8286,8288,8289,8290,
8301,9098,9099,9100,10503,10504,10505,10506,10507,10508,10509,10510,10511,10512,
10513,10514,10515,10516,10517,10518,10519,10520,10521,10522,10523,10524,10525,10
526,10527,10528,10529,10530,10531,10532,10533,10534,10535,10536,10537,10538,1053
9,10540,10541,10542,10543,10544,10545,10546,10547,10548,10549,10550,10551,10552,
11832,11833,12129,13186,13754,13781,14073,14074,14076,14077,14079,14080,14082,14
083,14085,14086,14088,14089};
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Don’t be a retard seriously… The integer has too many values in it, make a capes2[] and put some in that.
[/quote]I’m the retard? You’re the one who thinks that the server will read off the capes value from a whole new integer.[/quote]

Lmao.

You’re cracking me up right here.

Put you’re dummy back in, and maybe drink your bottle, meanwhile i’ll do the hard work for you, and no i’m not changing your nappy.

Find

public int itemType(int item) {

Add under:

for (int i = 0; i < Item.capes2.length; i++) {
if(item == Item.capes2[i]) {
return playerCape;
}
}

Now create

public static int capes2[] = {};

And take out some capes from capes[] to capes2[].

“Retard”.

Read full topic
